title: 10 Easy Ways to Reset Your Gut
description: Use these 10 Strategies to start your journey towards a revitalized gut today!
cleaned_text: Are you looking to revitalize your gut health? Look no further! In this comprehensive guide, we'll share 10 simple yet powerful techniques to help you reset your gut and improve your overall well-being. Whether you're experiencing digestive issues or simply want to optimize your gut health, these strategies are here to assist you. Let's dive in! 1. Incorporate Fiber-Rich Foods Into Your Diet Discover the incredible benefits of fiber-rich foods in resetting your gut. High-fiber options like fruits, vegetables, and whole grains promote healthy digestion, regulate bowel movements, and support the growth of beneficial gut bacteria. To ensure you're getting enough, [consider adding in a supplement like Move](https://www.cleanprogram.com/products/move). 2. Stay Hydrated for Optimal Digestion Proper hydration is essential for a well-functioning gut. Adequate water intake helps break down food, soften stools, and prevent constipation. Aim to drink at least 8 glasses of water each day to maintain optimal hydration. 3. Consume Fermented Foods for Gut Nourishment Fermented foods such as sauerkraut and kimchi are packed with probiotics that promote a healthy gut flora. Including these foods in your diet enhances digestion, reduces inflammation, and strengthens your immune system. 4. Minimize Processed Foods and Sugar Intake Reducing your consumption of processed foods and sugar is crucial for gut health. These items can disrupt the balance of gut bacteria and lead to inflammation. Opt for whole, unprocessed foods to support a healthy gut environment. 5. Mindful Eating Practices for Improved Digestion Practicing mindful eating can significantly benefit your gut health. Slow down, savor each bite, and pay attention to your body's hunger and fullness cues. This mindful approach aids in better digestion and prevents overeating. Our [7-Day](https://www.cleanprogram.com/products/clean7) and [21-Day Cleanse](https://www.cleanprogram.com/products/clean21) Programs focus on prioritizing mindfulness with nutrient-rich habit building to jumpstart or reset your body's natural, optimized functions. 6. Prioritize Stress Management Techniques Chronic stress can negatively impact your gut health. Engage in stress-reducing activities such as meditation, yoga, or deep breathing exercises. By managing stress, you can restore harmony in your gut and improve digestion. 7. Consider Probiotic Supplements for Gut Balance Supplementing with probiotics can help replenish and balance the beneficial bacteria in your gut. Additionally, this potent probiotic supplement may help relieve some symptoms of IBS. 8. Experiment with Gut-Healing Herbs and Supplements Certain herbs and supplements, like slippery elm or [aloe vera,](https://www.cleanprogram.com/collections/supplements/products/integrity) process gut-healing properties. Incorporating them into your routine can sooth and repair your gut lining, promoting optimized digestive function. 9. Get Moving with Regular Exercise Regular physical activity supports healthy digestion and overall gut health. Engage in exercises that you enjoy and aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise most days of the week. On one of our Cleanse Programs? No sweat! Our energy during the cleanse is focused on healing - with less digestion to handle, your body sends that energy to various points throughout the body to do repairs. When we exercise, we divert that energy from the task at hand. However, movement is so important! That's why we recommend that even on a Cleanse you continue to move your body in some way - either by reducing your regular activity to half, taking rejuvenating walks, or planning time for healthy restorative yoga. For more information, [consider scheduling a Free Consultation with one of our Wellness Coaches ](https://www.cleanprogram.com/pages/talk-to-a-coach). 10. Prioritize Quality Sleep for Gut Restoration Quality sleep plays a vital role in gut restoration. Aim for 7-9 hours of uninterrupted sleep each night to allow your body to repair and rejuvenate.
